name: src/Check.ts
Check
examples:
<caption>Choose from two alternatives</caption>
 import { Check, equals } from '@serenity-js/assertions';

 actor.attemptsTo(
     Check.whether(process.env.MODE, equals('prod'))
         .andIfSo(
             LogInAsProdUser(),
         )
         .otherwise(
             LogInAsTestUser(),
         )
 );

<caption>Choose whether or not to perform an activity</caption>
 import { Check, equals } from '@serenity-js/assertions';
 import { isDiplayed } from '@serenity-js/protractor';

 actor.attemptsTo(
     Check.whether(NewsletterModal(), isDisplayed())
         .andIfSo(
             DismissModal(),
         )
 );

name: toString
description: Generates a description to be used when reporting this {@link @serenity-js/core/lib/screenplay~Activity}.

name: src/Expectation.ts
Expectation
description:
Defines an expectation to be used with:
 - {@link Ensure} - to perform a verification
 - {@link Check} - to control the execution flow

name: thatActualShould
description: Used to define a simple {@link Expectation}
